isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - ASSEMBLE - OUTPUT SHAFT ASSEMBLY

caution.para: When heating the bearings, do not heat bearings above 275° F (136°C).

step1.para: Use toolmaker's dye and mark the LO range gear for timing purposes ( Figure 195).

figure.caption: Figure 195. Mark LO Range Gear For Timing Purposes

step1.para: Mark any two (2) adjacent teeth on the LO range gear. Repeat the procedure for the two (2) adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked.
Place the splined washer on the output shaft shoulder ( Figure 196).
Position LO range gear clutching teeth down, install on the output shaft and engage the washer splines ( Figure 196).
With the smooth side up, position the LO range gear rear washer on the output shaft against the LO range gear. Move LO gear around to center the washer ( Figure 197).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Position LO Range Gear Rear Washer on Output Shaft

step1.para: With tapered side up, use heat or appropriate driver and install the output shaft front rear bearing (the larger bearing) ( Figure 198).

figure.caption: Figure 198. Install Output Shaft Front Rear Bearing

step1.para: Position the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft ( Figure 199). Set aside.

figure.caption: Figure 199. Position Bearing Inner Spacer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Lay the auxiliary housing front face down on a clean, flat surface ( Figure 200). Install the bearing race in the bearing bore.

figure.caption: Figure 200. Install Bearing Race in Bearing Bore
